Z okay me explain to everyone what what a Zone transfer is in DNS you have the kind you have
redundance between primary and secondary DNS Sur and um from the outside you
can't really see who the primary and who the secondary is but between them they have a relationship that defines who's
primary and who's secondary so when you update the NF you change it on one server and the secondary the lower range
VF servers want to be able to get those upd it's aesome and they do that using a Zone transfer Zone transfer is a TCP
connection on Port 53 and essentially what's going to happen is the primary server is going to just D its entire
Zone file for that domain down to the second VI the second is going to update its records and cycle up and and and be
updated right and um in theory it's only supposed to be used between Z between
Nam zones that have a relationship but what's happened is what happens a lot is that the configuration is is done wrong
and the zone and the server allows Zone transfers for I addresses that don't necessarily have a relationship with um
it's it's it's essentially a security error but it's very very common and you can ask for a Zone transfer from a from
a name server with the host minus L command so you say host minus L and the
and the domain that you want to transfer and if that name server is allowing
transfers then it will transfer the entire domain through just drop its entire Zone file that sent down and then
